policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing the use, restriction, and prohibition of system media types including removable storage devices
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.07 requires restricting or prohibiting use of organization-defined media types using technical and non-technical measures including policies and procedures

policies.name: Acceptable Use Policy
policies.description: Policy defining acceptable use of organizational systems and peripheral devices including media usage restrictions
policies.rationale: Control requires rules of behavior for media use; AUP provides organizational standards for acceptable media usage practices

procedures.name: Media Use Control Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for implementing technical controls to restrict media usage including disabling USB ports, configuring device control policies, and managing approved device lists
procedures.rationale: Control discusses technical measures such as physical cages, disabling ports, and removing write capabilities requiring documented implementation procedures

procedures.name: Approved Media Device Registration Procedure
procedures.description: Process for registering, approving, and tracking organization-provided and approved removable media devices with identifiable owners
procedures.rationale: Control requires prohibiting removable media without identifiable owners and limiting use to approved devices requiring formal registration process

procedures.name: Media Use Exception Request Procedure
procedures.description: Process for requesting, approving, and documenting exceptions to media use restrictions with compensating controls
procedures.rationale: Organizations may need exception processes for legitimate business needs while maintaining security controls and accountability

executionEvidence.name: Approved Removable Media Device Inventory
executionEvidence.description: Current list showing: device type, serial number, assigned owner, approval date, business justification, expiration date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires identifiable owners for removable media; inventory demonstrates ongoing compliance with ownership requirements

executionEvidence.name: USB/Media Port Disable Configuration Reports
executionEvidence.description: Technical reports showing: systems with disabled USB ports, GPO/Intune policies applied, configuration verification dates, exception systems with justification
executionEvidence.rationale: Control discusses disabling ports and removing capabilities; reports demonstrate technical controls are implemented and maintained

executionEvidence.name: Device Control Policy Compliance Scans
executionEvidence.description: Automated scan results showing: systems scanned, device control policy status, unauthorized devices detected, remediation actions taken
executionEvidence.rationale: Continuous monitoring required to detect unauthorized media usage; weekly scans align with industry best practices for endpoint compliance

executionEvidence.name: Media Use Violation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Incident reports showing: violation date, user, device type, detection method, corrective action, disciplinary action if applicable
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates enforcement of media use restrictions and organizational response to policy violations

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Media Use Compliance Audits
executionEvidence.description: Audit reports showing: technical controls tested, approved device list reviewed, compliance rate, gaps identified, remediation plan
executionEvidence.rationale: Periodic validation that media use controls remain effective; quarterly frequency aligns with typical audit cycles

operationalActivities: Maintain approved removable media device inventory with identifiable owners
Configure and enforce USB port restrictions via GPO or Intune policies
Deploy device control policies to prevent unauthorized media usage
Scan endpoints weekly for compliance with media use restrictions
Register and approve new removable media devices before use
Investigate and document media use policy violations
Review and update approved device list monthly
Test technical controls quarterly to verify effectiveness
Remove or disable media access for terminated employees within 24 hours
Audit media use controls quarterly and document findings

policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy requiring cryptographic protection for backup media and storage locations containing CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.09 requires protecting confidentiality of backup information using cryptographic mechanisms at backup storage locations

policies.name: Data Protection and Encryption Policy
policies.description: Policy defining encryption requirements for data at rest including backup data, minimum encryption standards, and key management requirements
policies.rationale: Control requires implementing cryptographic mechanisms; policy establishes organizational standards for encryption strength and methods

policies.name: Cryptographic Standards Policy
policies.description: Policy specifying approved cryptographic algorithms, key lengths, and cryptographic module requirements (FIPS 140-2/3 validated)
policies.rationale: Control discussion references cryptographic mechanism selection and HSM devices; policy ensures use of validated cryptographic implementations

procedures.name: Backup Encryption Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for configuring backup software to encrypt backup data, selecting encryption algorithms, managing encryption keys, and verifying encryption is active
procedures.rationale: Control requires implementing cryptographic mechanisms for backups requiring documented implementation procedures

procedures.name: Backup Key Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for generating, storing, rotating, and destroying cryptographic keys used for backup encryption including HSM usage if applicable
procedures.rationale: Control discussion mentions HSM devices for key management; procedure ensures proper cryptographic key lifecycle management

procedures.name: Encrypted Backup Restoration Testing Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodically testing encrypted backup restoration including key retrieval, decryption verification, and data integrity validation
procedures.rationale: Organizations must verify encrypted backups can be successfully restored; testing ensures cryptographic protection doesn't prevent recovery

procedures.name: Backup Storage Location Security Procedure
procedures.description: Process for securing physical and cloud backup storage locations including access controls, encryption verification, and monitoring
procedures.rationale: Control requires preventing unauthorized disclosure at backup storage locations requiring secured storage procedures

executionEvidence.name: Backup Encryption Configuration Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: backup systems inventoried, encryption enabled status, encryption algorithm used, key length, FIPS validation status, configuration verification date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing compliance with encryption requirements; monthly verification ensures configurations remain secure

executionEvidence.name: Backup Job Completion Logs with Encryption Verification
executionEvidence.description: Automated logs showing: backup date/time, systems backed up, backup success/failure, encryption applied confirmation, backup destination
executionEvidence.rationale: Daily backups are industry standard; logs demonstrate encryption is consistently applied to all backup operations

executionEvidence.name: Encrypted Backup Restoration Test Results
executionEvidence.description: Test reports showing: test date, backup selected, restoration success, decryption successful, data integrity verified, time to restore, tester signature
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST SP 800-34 recommends quarterly backup restoration testing; validates encrypted backups remain recoverable

executionEvidence.name: Cryptographic Key Rotation Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: key rotation date, systems affected, old key archived, new key deployed, rotation completed successfully
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST SP 800-57 recommends periodic key rotation; logs demonstrate proper cryptographic key lifecycle management

executionEvidence.name: Backup Storage Location Security Assessments
executionEvidence.description: Assessment reports showing: storage location reviewed, physical/logical access controls verified, encryption at rest confirmed, vulnerabilities identified, remediation status
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires preventing unauthorized disclosure at storage locations; assessments verify storage security remains adequate

executionEvidence.name: HSM Device Audit Logs
executionEvidence.description: If applicable, logs showing: cryptographic operations performed, key access events, administrative actions, anomaly detection alerts
executionEvidence.rationale: Control discussion references HSM devices; audit logs demonstrate secure key management and detect unauthorized access attempts

operationalActivities: Configure all backup systems to encrypt backup data using approved cryptographic algorithms
Verify backup encryption is enabled and functioning for all daily backup jobs
Store backup encryption keys securely using HSM or approved key management system
Rotate backup encryption keys annually or per policy requirements
Test encrypted backup restoration quarterly to ensure recoverability
Monitor backup storage locations for unauthorized access attempts
Maintain backup encryption configuration documentation
Review backup encryption logs monthly for anomalies or failures
Conduct semi-annual security assessments of backup storage locations
Update backup encryption configurations when cryptographic standards change
Validate FIPS 140-2/3 compliance of cryptographic modules used for backup encryption
Archive old encryption keys securely per retention requirements
Document and investigate any backup encryption failures immediately
